svg.text: Week in Ethereum News - April 9 2017
April 9 2017

title: "Week in Ethereum News
April 9, 2017" date: "2017-04-09"
News and Links
Top
• If you want to catch up on Ethereum research: Vitalik’s Q1 Roundup Vitalik asks how Ethereum Research can improve communication . 99% of
respondents misunderstand and suggest general communication strategies. Sigh.
If you want to catch up on Ethereum research: Vitalik’s Q1 Roundup
• Vitalik asks how Ethereum Research can improve communication . 99% of respondents misunderstand and suggest general communication
strategies. Sigh.
• A vision for how Brave’s Basic Attention Token leads to Ethereum mass adoption
A vision for how Brave’s Basic Attention Token leads to Ethereum mass adoption
Protocol
• Sami Mäkelä: Formalizing Ethereum transactions
• Ethereum Name Service audit results
• Vitalik is optimistic about lowering inflation: “I expect future net inflation will eventually go slightly negative once there’s a high
volume of transactions on the network.”
Stuff for Dapp developers
• Golem found a bug on a major exchange that left tokens at risk worth millions. The exchange hadn’t verified input MyEtherWallet’s
kvhnuke: “ It is easy to say it is ethereum’s fault rather than typing str.length == 42 ”
Golem found a bug on a major exchange that left tokens at risk worth millions.
• The exchange hadn’t verified input
• MyEtherWallet’s kvhnuke: “ It is easy to say it is ethereum’s fault rather than typing str.length == 42 ”
• Piper Merriam: the state of tools for the Python Ethereum ecosystem
Piper Merriam: the state of tools for the Python Ethereum ecosystem
• Bringing the web3 API to the browser
Bringing the web3 API to the browser
• Signing into the backend with Ethereum and JSON Web Tokens
Signing into the backend with Ethereum and JSON Web Tokens
Ecosystem
• Polychain Capital is hiring a Senior Operations Manager and Trader/Portfolio Manager. I might have applied if I was willing to live in
the Bay Area.
Polychain Capital is hiring a Senior Operations Manager and Trader/Portfolio Manager. I might have applied if I was willing to live in
• Status talks to Luis Cuende from Aragon They also interviewed some guy named Evan Van Ness .
Status talks to Luis Cuende from Aragon
• They also interviewed some guy named Evan Van Ness .
• Accept payments in Ether on WooCommerce
Accept payments in Ether on WooCommerce
• WeTrust chats with Tendermint/Cosmo’s Jae Kwon and with Golem’s Julian Zawistowski
WeTrust chats with Tendermint/Cosmo’s Jae Kwon and with Golem’s Julian Zawistowski
• Numerai’s Xander Dunn on Software Engineering Daily podcast
Numerai’s Xander Dunn on Software Engineering Daily podcast
• ethPay: encrypted chatting via Whisper
ethPay: encrypted chatting via Whisper
• Jason Teutsch & Christian Reitwiessner discuss TrueBit on Epicenter
Jason Teutsch & Christian Reitwiessner discuss TrueBit on Epicenter
Project Updates
• What VirtuePoker has been up to
• How To: Create A Good Market on Augur
• New Melonport explainer video
• WeiFund’s first crowdfunding? Feature film Braid to raise capital on WeiFund
• Brendan Eich interview on Basic Attention Token How BAT reduces online ad fraud ConsenSys’ Adchain: Ad Tech Landscape Today: Existing
Problems As We See Them I finally switched to the Brave browser and highly recommend it.
• How BAT reduces online ad fraud
• ConsenSys’ Adchain: Ad Tech Landscape Today: Existing Problems As We See Them
• I finally switched to the Brave browser and highly recommend it.
Token Sales
• Lots of gnashing of teeth this week over the Gnosis auction mechanics. I’m very happy they are taking a risk and forging a path where
the market decides valuations. Not every project should sell 80% up front; some will need additional token sales to scale. Updated Gnosis
white paper
Lots of gnashing of teeth this week over the Gnosis auction mechanics. I’m very happy they are taking a risk and forging a path where the
market decides valuations. Not every project should sell 80% up front; some will need additional token sales to scale.
• Updated Gnosis white paper
• Smith & Crown on iEx.ec
Smith & Crown on iEx.ec
• Cosmos raised $17m USD in 30 minutes .
Cosmos raised $17m USD in 30 minutes .
• DRAMA: Matchpool co-founder burns bridges on his way out and accuses the CEO of stealing funds. Turns out CEO had just moved some ETH to
Bitcoin to hedge , as previously promised . However, poor transparency that co-founders were fighting during crowdsale and yet they told
no one. Token sale purchasers can get a refund if they want one.
DRAMA: Matchpool co-founder burns bridges on his way out and accuses the CEO of stealing funds. Turns out CEO had just moved some ETH to
• I wrote some thoughts on Blockchain Capital’s token sale . I may have been on the tough side about their returns, but the lack of
disclosure and transparency was very disappointing. It still sold out all $10 million in a day.
I wrote some thoughts on Blockchain Capital’s token sale . I may have been on the tough side about their returns, but the lack of
disclosure and transparency was very disappointing.
• It still sold out all $10 million in a day.
General
• Split a seed mnemonic for crypto wallets to multiple mnemonics .
• Latest issue of The Etherian . The number of projects they cover continues to grow
• It’s official: Eris put the EVM on Hyperledger
• Manuel Stagars’ blockchain documentary: The Blockchain and Us
• Just a few days to withdraw DAO To ETC refunds
Dates of note
[For ongoing sales, check previous week ]
• April 12 – iEx.ec sale begins
• April 12 – WeTrust sale ends
• April 14 – Humaniq price change
• April 15 - Ethbits sale begins
• April 24 – Gnosis sale begins
• April 24-25 – Rice Blockchain for Business conference. [ Registration open]
• April 25 – Sikoba public sale begins.However, a pre-sale is already open
• April 25 – Veritaseum sale begins
• April 26 – Lunyr sale closes
• May 10 – Boscoin sale begins
• May 25 - William Mougayar’s Token Summit in NYC. For a limited time you can use discount code WIENews for 20% off. I’m planning on
being there.
Bias transparency : if you host a blockchain conference and don’t use Ticketleap , I’m much less likely to include your conference, unless
you have a good reason as to why we’re not a good fit. But I doubt you have one, because we’re likely a great fit. /shamelessplug
[I aim for a relatively comprehensive list of Ethereum sales, but make no warranty as to even whether they are legit; as such, I thus
likewise warrant nothing about whether any will produce a satisfactory return. I have passed the CFA exams , but this is not investment
advice. If you’re interested in what I do, you can find my investing thesis and token sale appreciation strategies in previous
newsletters.]
Errors or additions: evan@ticketleap.com
LAST CALL: Register for Rice Business and Blockchain conference
When: April 24 & 25 Where: Rice University Jones School of Business Who: The speaker list speaks for itself
Register now to reserve your spot.
If you’re still scrolling down, why not share?
This newsletter is supported by Status.im . But in case you still want to send Ether (or tokens?):
